title: Legendary Patriots kicker Adam Vinatieri elected to Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Adam Vinatieri inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame during NFL Honors ceremony, becoming the third kicker to achieve this.
Vinatieri is the NFL's all-time scoring leader with 2,673 points and holds the record for made field-goals with 599.
He won four Super Bowl titles, three with the Patriots and one with the Colts, over his 24-season career.

title: Drake Maye loses MVP race to Matthew Stafford by razor-thin margin
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye finished second to Matthew Stafford for NFL MVP, with Stafford earning 24 first-place votes to Maye's 23.
Matthew Stafford led the NFL in passing yards and touchdowns, while Drake Maye led in completion percentage and QBR.
Josh Allen and Justin Herbert received votes, with Allen earning two first-place votes and Herbert one in the MVP race.

title: Mike Vrabel named 2025 NFL Coach of the Year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel named 2025 NFL Coach of the Year at the NFL Honors ceremony for turning around the New England Patriots.
Vrabel previously won NFL Coach of the Year in 2021 with the Tennessee Titans, joining elite coaches with multiple wins.
Under Vrabel, the 2025 Patriots finished 17-3 and are set to play in Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara.

title: Unlike Tom Brady, Tedy Bruschi has a dog in the Patriots-Seahawks fight
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tedy Bruschi is openly supporting the Patriots in their Super Bowl LX matchup against the Seahawks.
Bruschi's allegiance is influenced by his friendship with Patriots coach Mike Vrabel, an eight-year teammate.
He praised the Patriots' performance this postseason, highlighting their strong defense and ability to win in various scenarios.

title: Pedestrian struck by police cruiser at UMass Lowell, officials say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A pedestrian was struck by a police cruiser near UMass Lowell's McGauvran Center Thursday evening.
The incident occurred around 6:30 p.m. at the intersection of Wilder and Bachelder streets in Lowell.
Lowell police and Massachusetts State Police are investigating; UMass Lowell offers counseling for witnesses.

title: New Bedford police investigate after man goes missing, drowns in harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Vasquez, 51, was found dead in New Bedford Harbor on January 31 after being missing since January 28.
Vasquez was last seen at a local adult establishment before being reported missing by his boss on January 30.
New Bedford and Massachusetts State Police are investigating the drowning, with no indication yet of foul play.

title: Cambridge brewery workers plan to unionize, file for election
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Workers at Lamplighter Brewing Co. in Cambridge filed for a union election with UFCW Local 1445.
The union would represent employees across Lamplighter's two locations at 284 Broadway and 110 North First St.
Employees seek a stronger voice and increased consistency in the changing brewery industry landscape.

title: Patriots OC Josh McDaniels named AP Assistant Coach of the Year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels wins AP Assistant Coach of the Year at NFL Honors in San Francisco.
Under McDaniels, Patriots' offense improved from third-lowest to second-highest scoring in the NFL.
McDaniels, on third stint with Patriots, open to staying despite past head coaching roles.

title: Patriots, Seahawks both have defensive starters missing from practice
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots linebacker Robert Spillane was upgraded to limited practice participation, while Harold Landry missed practice due to a knee injury.
Seahawks rookie safety Nick Emmanwori was sidelined from practice with an ankle injury but is expected to play Sunday.
Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald expressed optimism about Emmanwori's status, indicating a cautious approach to his recovery.

title: NY man allegedly stole $325K in seafood from Worcester warehouse in 1 of several heists
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Romoy Forbes, 31, charged with stealing seafood, blueberries, and cologne worth over $1 million from warehouses.
Forbes allegedly used hacked email accounts to pose as a carrier, transporting stolen goods for illicit sale.
If convicted, Forbes faces up to 10 years for stolen goods charge and 5 years for conspiracy.
